column4: does anyone know how to set your default SSID for network-admin
my SSID is somehow defaulted not to my home network in network-admin.  does anyone know a way to change this?
Anyone know how to change your default SSID in network-admin?
network-admin automatically connects to any network you've connected to before. You have to go in with gconf and delete some keys related to the network ssids
in system i don't have networking..only dns_sd gstreamer http_proxy proxy and smb
are sure you sure you're in /system and not /schemas/system?
Yes, system is the last tab below schemas
asdf: which distro are you using?
Yes, but it does not detect my wireless
do you know where the config setitngs are for network-manager
too unfortunate. I'm not 100% sure, but /etc/network/interfaces might be the file that network-manager uses
note that's a file, its not in gconf
I think that did it...I'm going to chekc
